description:
{RHelp Topic{W:{x discipline

 Disciplines will be a substitute for classes and then again not. Like
classes they determine which direction, skill-wise, a player wishes to take
their character, but unlike classes they have no restrictions on what skills
one can obtain. In other words at creation when a person chooses their
discipline, they must think about what type of character they are wanting to
play. Do they want a fighter, thief, monk, priest, psionisist, mage, or
perhaps a combination of the two or three or more. A player will have to
choose the discipline that they believe will be most helpful for their
character.

 There are four disciplines, they are: Physical, Mental, Divine,
and Mystical. All skills and spells will be divided up into these four
catagories. Learning a skill from your discipline will not be to big of
deal, but learning skills from outside your discipline will require more
skill points. Which in return will cut down on the number of skills you can
learn.

The {Bphysical{x discipline deals with physical skills of course.
Martial arts, weapons, and thief skills will all be apart of the
physical group. Anyone who wishes to create a rogue or fighter type
character will be best off choosing this discipline.

The {Bmental{x discipline deals with mental abilities of the mind.
Psionics is the major lump of skills for this group, although a few other
skills like meditation will be a part of this discipline as well.
Anyone wishing to create a powerful psionic type will need this discipline.

The {Bdivine{x discipline is based around deities and religion. Any skill
granted to players by a deity is in this group, as always there may be
a few exceptions. Players wishing to play a priest or other religious
fanatic type will benefit the most from this discipline.

The {Bmystical{x discipline is all other things magical. All skills
dealing with magic, such as using wands or brewing potions, to casting and
scribing spells will be in the mystical group. Anyone wishing to create a
powerful mage, rune mage, or other powerful magic type will definately need
this discipline.
